page.title: 18Glassenbury Manor House.
page.content: Moated house dating from l472. Present mansion buillt near site of former house lies in a valley surrounded by about 40 acres of parkland and lakes containing many mature trees. The present owner has lived here for two years and has embarked on a tree planting scheme with oaks, beech, and many other species. The moat contains golden carp and there are various breeds of ducks and swans on the lakes. The main house is approached down a long gravel drive over a bridge to a magnificent wooden front door. The house itself contains many exposed beams and fireplaces. There is another dwelling besides called the Coachouse and the Lodge and Forge are by the main gate. The manor house belonged for many years to the Roberts family. Now much of the original estate has been sold or is managed by local farmers.
